column4: So recapitulating: My network manager says I'm connected, yet I don't get answers to pings anywhere except localhost. I tried pinging both 8.8.8.8 and my original nameserver. Thoughts?
did you try : sudo service Network-Manager restart ?
might be in lower case.
or sudo killall nm-applet
or sudo service networking restart
restarted successfully using service restart, no change though.
this is 11.10 desktop i assume ?
i assume you've ensured that you have a valid network connection profile active in the network manager applet?
does sudo ifconfig reveal an interface with an IP address?
it does. Supposedly I'm connected, too.
what is the output of routes?
exact same thing as on my laptop with working wireless
and the wirless access point is the intended gateway for your desktop too?
ok i assumed you were using wired. what does iwconfig reveal?
no sizeable difference in output from iwconfig between my working and failing connection
by the way thanks for the help
if I have the same iwconfig as a healthy connection, can I check anything else?
i would check if it can see access points : sudo iwlist wlan0 scan (where wlan0 is the interface for the wifi)
I can.
are you using two wifi devices? are they embedded? or are they/it just a wifi usb dongle that you are using between your two computers?
in other words: could it be a faulty device?
ifnot is the signal between client and accesspoint strong?
both computers are running on integrated wireless cards that are supposed to be supported by the kernel version.
i'm out of ideas
